meanings.definition: The quality or state of being closely connected or appropriate to the matter at hand.
meanings.sent1: The relevance of the evidence to the case was clear.
meanings.sent2: Her comments had no relevance to the discussion.
meanings.sent3: The relevance of wearing a hat in the rain became apparent when he got soaked.
meanings.sent4: The relevance of time in a dream is like a fleeting shadow.
meanings.sent5: The relevance of kindness in everyday life shines brightly.

meanings.definition: The degree to which something is important or significant to a particular topic or situation.
meanings.sent1: The relevance of the document to the project was crucial.
meanings.sent2: His experience added relevance to the team's decision-making process.
meanings.sent3: The relevance of a clown at a funeral would surely raise some eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: The relevance of a single drop in the ocean is like a tiny ripple in a vast sea.
meanings.sent5: The relevance of music in a movie can make or break the entire film.
